data.title: Villagers bring their resources to nearest building
data.body:
regardless of the building type. It can be houses, towers, ...

Normal behaviour would be that they bring them to the town center, lumberjack building, mining building or mill. I should be dependant of the type of resource

data.title: The king can kill enemy units too
data.body:
when I remember correctly this was not possible in the original game

data.title: Tree clipping bug in the bottom corners of the screen
data.body: When I move the camera around the world, trees in the bottom corners are disapearing to early. You can also see them popping up again.

data.title: When attacking with a group of archers, one takes damage as well
data.body:
When I have a group of archers and attack the enemy villagers, one random archer from my group takes damage too.

data.title: Attempt at cleaning up buildsystem
data.body: Buildsystem restructuring and cleanup.

data.title: Peer to peer mod sharing
data.body:
Although not much practical use currently, we should be able to share mods via p2p. We should use some DHT, e.g. use trackerless `libtorrent`, ...

We don't need some ugly forum where people post zip files but instead they share magic links.

Everyone posessing a mod is a potential seeder of course.

This should be part of our mod manager, not the main game. Further ideas? :grinning: 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26184699-peer-to-peer-mod-sharing?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Custom cursors
data.body: Something similar to the AOE2 flag, or the way in which the cursor changes based on the action.

data.body:
No more words are needed.

data.title: Entity (character) click-box is too small
data.body: It's mainly focussed around their feet. When you click their head or upper body, they aren't selected. Perhaps the clickbox should take into account the height of entities too?

data.title: Telling multiple entities to move at the same time makes them all say their respective phrases
data.body:
With only a few characters, it sounds harmonic. With more than 10, it begins to break the speakers.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26170614-telling-multiple-entities-to-move-at-the-same-time-makes-them-all-say-their-respective-phrases?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: New pathfinding and grouping
data.body: Presumably you use some form of grid-based A\* algorithm? Maybe it is better to 'group' nearby searches to reduce the stress of re-calculating paths that are very similar.

data.title: Animations are too fast
data.body: This doesn't apply to all animations, but some (villager chopping down tree) are considerably faster than they should be. Comical, but a little odd.

data.title: Villager carry resource types 'switch'
data.body: I had a villager who was carry a lot of berries. When I told him to go collect gold instead, his berries miraculously turned into gold (it wasn't just an animation either - when he went back to the Town Centre, it registered it as gold resource). Either this is a bug, or you've added an alchemy feature.

data.title: Villagers don't carry resources back to Town Centre
data.body:
Kind of self-explanatory. Although, interestingly, they do carry things back when carrying gold.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26170424-villagers-don-t-carry-resources-back-to-town-centre?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fix for text renderer causing game crash
data.body: fixes #358

data.title: Unable to build on OS X 10.9
data.body:
I was trying to follow instructions from https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/blob/master/doc/building.md, but I was unable to compile. I installed all the prerequisites, but build failed with error message:

```
me@mac:openage$ make
...
[  2%] Building CXX object libopenage/CMakeFiles/libopenage.dir/game_control.cpp.o
/Users/Hannes/Desktop/openage/libopenage/game_control.cpp:385:8: error: no matching member function for call to 'bind'
    this->bind(input::action_t::ENABLE_BUILDING_PLACEMENT, [this](const input::action_arg_t &) {
    ~~~~~~^~~~
1 error generated.
make[3]: *** [libopenage/CMakeFiles/libopenage.dir/game_control.cpp.o] Error 1
make[2]: *** [libopenage/CMakeFiles/libopenage.dir/all] Error 2
make[1]: *** [all] Error 2
make: *** [build] Error 2
```

OS stats:
- OS X 10.9 Maverics
- clang-600.0.57
- configured with `./configure --compiler=clang`

data.title: Rendering Glitch: Purple Trees
data.body:
Running Mesa 11.0-git, Arch Linux 64bit, MATE, AMD Radeon HD 7750.

I don't remember trees being this purple in the original game. Most likely a Mesa bug.

![Purple Trees](http://i.imgur.com/M3hdd6j.png)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26108012-rendering-glitch-purple-trees?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

Running Mesa 11.0-git, Arch Linux 64bit, MATE, AMD Radeon HD 7750.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch the game, wait for it to load.
2. Go to generate_game().
3. Hit [m] until the resource list appears (Gold, Food etc)
4. Crash!

data.title: Text renderer with support for colors
No configure check for pygments
data.body:
Not having it installed results in a make error, rather than a configure error
This is different to pil & numpy

I should think this is very easy to fix :D

data.title: Ship fonts with the game.
data.body: By providing the fonts required for the game in the assets folder, we can remove the dependencies dejavu font and fontconfig.

data.title: Console constructor throwing SIGSEGV signal
data.body: Currently, the constructor of Console is determining the size of a character by using the FTGL font's advance function. This function is producing a SIGSEGV error in the testing system (coords), where engine and OpenGL context is not created.

data.title: What should the in-game console actually do one day?
data.body:
In my opinion, there are 3 things we could do with the console:
1. We could make an **interactive python console**, much like the one in blender. We could use python's _code.InteractiveConsole_ module in combination with cython for this.
2. Or we could make a **terminal emulator**. We could use unix' _pipe_, _fork_ and _exec_ calls for running a shell like the bash _in the game_.
3. Or we could make a **simple shell / tcl - like scripting "language"**, but I don't think this would have any advantage over a python console.

I personally like the first one the most, but I don't know how you guys think about this.

data.title: in-game console UTF-8 backspace support
data.body: Supports UTF-8 characters and line-wrapping just fine.

data.title: 'log-tail' in-game console command
data.body:
It's an in-game console command that shows you the 8 latest log messages.
BTW, The log sink I created for this (TailSink) doesn't store any older messages than these 8 since openage's logs get big really fast and it would just litter the user's RAM.

P.S.:I've reuploaded this pull request because I accidentally pushed my master branch in the first request. Sorry!

data.title: Update building.md
data.body: Added Fedora 22 dependencies (switched from yum command to dnf)

data.title: 'log-tail' in-game console command
data.body:
It's an in-game console command that shows you the 8 latest log messages.
BTW, The log sink I created for this (TailSink) doesn't store any older messages than these 8 since openage's logs get big really fast and it would just litter the user's RAM.
